captions.text:
Today on BRStv we are going to show you a
laundry list of ways a Neptune controller
can save you some hard earned crispy dollars.

Hi, I'm Ryan host of BRStv where each week
we explore a new topic related to reef tanks,

this week we are going to explore the popular
Neptune Apex controller with a heavy focus

on how this thing is going to actually save
you money.

There are three main ways, first it is going
to replace a bunch of generally required equipment

pieces like power bars and timers, second
it is going to replace or add redundancy to

your system that is going to save your tank
and home in the long run. third is going to

add some nice features that are optional but
make reefing easier.

There are a couple of basic things almost
every tank out there needs, power bars, timers

or control for your lights and temperature
control. You can use cheap power bars like

this one but I think that's a mistake. We
have way too much time, money and passion

wrapped up in our tanks to trust the entire
life support system to a $4 piece of equipment.

I don't think you need to go crazy either,
there are some pretty good ones out there

for around $20. A decent digital timer is
around the same price.

Temperature control is also critical. At one
point i thought this was somewhat optional

but at this point I think it is pretty much
required for anyone who plans on having a

multiyear successful tank. Temperature related
issues are easily the single biggest cause

of tank crashes out there. Starting with your
heater, really doesn't matter which brand
you choose they will all fail eventually.

Some of the more popular types rely completely
on a ten cent single point of contact, some

will fail off and worse some fail on. Either
way it is bad news. Only real solution is

an external temperature controller to add
redundancy as well as alert you when a heater

fails. Since heaters are often hidden down
in our sumps it is really easy to not know

when something goes wrong so the alarm is
pretty critical.

Beyond that hot summers, cold winters, furnace
failures, air conditioners getting turned

off, hot lights , chiller failures and a whole
slew of other things are super common issues

and can all also result in tank crashes. More
or less the only real solution is again temperature

controllers to prevent issues as well as notify
you that the problem exists.

For example if the tank is overheating, you
can use the controller to cut power to the

heater, if it is still rising because it is
super hot out and someone forgot to turn on

your air conditioning or worse it breaks,
a temp controller can turn on a fan, still

rising turn on a chiller or start turning
off sources of heat like lights, unnecessary
pumps, or equipment like UV sterilizers.

This is about where the Neptune Apex Jr steps
in. It honestly doesn't make any sense to

buy a couple power bars, bulky timers and
slew of temperature controllers when you can

pick up a Apex Jr. for less and it's a platform
you can build off of for additional controls
and redundancy.

The next set of functions that can save you
money are primarily based around adding additional

redundancies and protections that can save
your tank or home from some pretty tragic

events. Most of us have hundreds to thousands
tied up in our tanks and more valuable, an

emotional connection to the fish, corals and
how the tank has evolved over the years. A

tank crash and starting over is out of the
question so we absolutely should protect it.

Beyond that we all have large glass boxes
of corrosive water in our homes, some of them

containing hundreds of gallons of water. Leaks,
top off failures and other issues can cause

serious damage your home. Replacing carpet,
hardwood floors, ceilings, walls, furniture,

electrical fires ... can all be ridiculously
expensive. While nothing is fool proof there

are a bunch of features on a controller like
this that can help protect your home.

The first of which is pH monitoring and control.
I have seen a lot of successful tanks that

range anywhere from 7.8 to 8.3. Once you get
out of that range it's often a sign that something

is wrong with the tank or equipment. Could
be something is wrong with your calcium reactor,

auto top off system failed and is over dosing
kalkwasser, a cheap timer running your two

part doser failed or something large died
in the tank.

Having a pH monitor which displays the pH
is nice but a good one costs $100 and isn't

helpful unless you are actually looking at
the tank when something bad happens which

is pretty darn rare. What we really need is
a controller with an alarm. So "A" it turns

off the equipment like the calcium reactor
that may be causing the issue and "B" notifies

you of the problem. A good stand-alone controller
with an alarm you can rely on is anywhere
from a hundred and twenty bucks to two hundred.

However a controller like the apex has this
feature built in. Better yet, you can run

multiple pH probes on the same controller
so you can monitor and control your calcium

reactor and the tank itself. Better yet you
can hook it up to the internet so it can email

or text you if there is ever a problem which
in the end makes it much more valuable than
a stand-alone controller.

These same features can save your home from
damage as well. Most of us will eventually

put an auto top off on our systems at some
point if, you are dosing kalk with your top

off and it failed on you could use the pH
controller to shut down the auto top off and

notify you before it ruins your carpet, hardwood
floors or ceiling.

If you are using fresh water you could utilize
their salinity probe to shut down the auto

top off if the salinity were ever to drop
below and acceptable level. And since we are

dealing with water basically anything can
develop a leak at some point or various issues

could cause the sump to overflow so they have
these nice leak detectors which you can put

on a flat surface or slide under your carpet.
This could easily save many people thousands
of dollars in damage.

Beyond all that you have the ability to add
float switches which can save you $100 to

$200 on a good auto top off. And while I don't
like relying solely on float switches for

this because they have moving parts that fail,
coupled with the salinity probe it is a very
safe solution.

Beyond all that the Apex is capable of controlling
your LED lights like the popular Aqua Illumination

models, sunset and rise effects on your Kessil
LED's, controlling ORP if you ever implement

ozone. control your EcoTech VorTech pumps,
add lunar lights to the tank, even operate
an automatic feeder.

At this point it should be pretty easy to
see how a controller like this could not only

save you money in equipment purchases but
even more valuable it can help you avoid all

the most common issues reefers encounter.
Anyone who has been in this hobby for more

than a couple years will tell you that heater
failure isn't an IF it is just a matter of

when. It is hard to believe but our entire
tank is resting solely on that ten cent piece
of metal functioning correctly.

And last but not least the Apex is capable
of detecting yet another fairly common occurrence,

power outages. Once it's detected, it can
turn on essential equipment like a pump for

gas exchange as well as use web based services
to notify you of the issue. So checkout the

comments below and share with other viewers
some interesting things you have done with

your controller as well as ask the community
any questions you might have. If this is your

first time with us don't forget to subscribe
because we do this every week. Thank you for
watching BRStv.

title: How an Apex Controller Can Save You Money - BRStv Product Spotlight
